radiographic_examinations.findings: A 5-mm calcified granuloma in the right lower lobe, fibrotic changes in the right lower lobe, a bleb at the right lung base, coronary artery calcifications, dilatation of the thoracic esophagus, diffuse hypoattenuation of the liver consistent with fat deposition, no focal hepatic lesions, a 7-mm hypodensity within the pancreatic head, an additional 9-mm lesion along the pancreatic tail, an area of non-mass-like hypoenhancement in the upper pole of the left kidney, mild wall thickening in several loops of jejunum without surrounding fat stranding, and multilevel degenerative changes of the thoracolumbar spine.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The 5-mm calcified granuloma, fibrotic changes, bleb, 7-mm hypodensity in the pancreatic head, 9-mm lesion in the pancreatic tail, and the upper pole of the left kidney area were unchanged. There has been essential resolution of the marked bowel dilatation compared to the prior study.
